messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Need game
messages.msgSnippet: ... We were driving in the car one winter day and I was thinking how dull and drab the world was with nothing but shades of grey and brown. And Kathryn piped
messages.messageBody:
on 1/10/03 11:10 PM, starsuncloud@... at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> ooh, I really like this idea! I think photography is a fabulous way to look
> at the world through a different lense, literally.
> And there are photo ops at the most unlikely places.....old buildings can be
> wonderful.

We were driving in the car one winter day and I was thinking how dull and
drab the world was with nothing but shades of grey and brown. And Kathryn
piped up "Aren't the trees beautiful?"

And they were :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Need game
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/10/03 6:51:02 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/10/03 6:51:02 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Hmm, OK.. I was thinking about giving the kids those $5 disposable cameras
and taking pix of "stuff" .. generally not considered beautiful.. . Then of
course, re examining the pictures to find the beauty. >>

ooh, I really like this idea! I think photography is a fabulous way to look
at the world through a different lense, literally.
And there are photo ops at the most unlikely places.....old buildings can be
wonderful.

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
